Snow White.Action: Gently calms and picks up a wounded magpie despite its struggle
Encourages and urges her friend William to hurry in helping the bird
Approaches and gently calms a wounded magpie, even when her companion is hesitant and alarmed.
Takes initiative by running quickly to get help for the wounded bird.
Brings wounded magpie to her parents, expresses concern and promises to look after it.
Plays and shares a moment of playful teasing with William, indicating friendly interaction.
Compliments Ravenna sincerely, showing admiration.
Engages gently and openly with Ravenna, a peer.
Smiles warmly and mimics Ravenna's touching of the heart, engaging sincerely in an emotional moment.
Her smile lights up the room but feels somewhat ambiguous, causing Ravenna to pause and question her sincerity.
Hears alarm and wakes up from sleep, showing alertness.
Stares in confusion at the chaos around her before running.
Rushes towards her father's chamber and stepmother upon seeing danger, showing initiative.
Notices her father's lifeless body but does not react immediately in this excerpt (no further action shown).
Turns and flees upon realizing the betrayal and seeing her father's dead body, with tears of shock welling in her eyes.
Stares defiantly at Ravenna despite being threatened with a dagger.
Silent and calm in captivity, showing no visible resentment or aggression.
Asks 'Why?' after being locked away, indicating sincerity and vulnerability.
Shows no hostile reaction or bitterness toward Ravenna despite long imprisonment.
Stares defiantly at Ravenna while held at dagger point, showing courage and resolve.
Remains silent and passive while locked away in a cell for years, appearing asleep and inactive.
Maintains eye contact with Ravenna repeatedly despite captivity, indicating awareness and mental resilience.
No direct action or involvement in the scene; passive or absent during critical moments.
Paces in her cell, frantic, showing visible distress but no sign of calm strategizing or control.
Notices the magpies' behavior and inspects the loose roofing nail near the cell window, attempting to remove it despite risk.
Uses the nail as a potential tool or weapon and tries to lure the guard closer with her eyes while gripping the nail.
Shakes her head gently when asked if she is awake, concealing her true intentions.
Does not take overt aggressive action when the guard enters and touches her; remains mostly passive.
Slashes Finn across the face and escapes, showing determination and self-defense.
Takes Rose's hands and looks into her eyes before leaving, indicating a sincere and gentle moment.
Throws keys into an empty cell instead of freeing Rose, likely to buy time or protect Rose.
Looks past tears at the devastation and state of desperate villagers approaching her.
Gallops away from desperate villagers and possible innocent approach without trying to help or communicate.
Kicks and fights her way back to the surface after being dragged underwater by seaweed, showing physical resilience and survival skill.
Follows the magpies' guidance despite initial uncertainty, demonstrating trust in external cues to navigate uncertainty.
Successfully mounts and rides the white mare quickly to escape pursuers, indicating decisiveness and horsemanship ability.
Stops the horse and assesses the devastated village and desperate people, showing situational awareness and emotional intelligence.
Gallops off when sensing danger from the villagers, prioritizing safety and escape over confrontation despite emotional conflict.
Urges her mare on to escape the riders despite hesitation, showing determination to protect herself and possibly others.
Attempts to grab the reins of her mare after being thrown off, showing concern for the animal's safety.
Reluctantly turns and runs into the forest to avoid capture, showing caution and survival instinct but also leaving others behind.
Presses on through hallucinations and dangers alone, indicating resilience but also isolation.
Stumbles repeatedly, overwhelmed by terrifying hallucinations, and eventually passes out.
Reacts in horror to being bound and struggles to free herself, showing immediate awareness and resistance.
Allows herself to be bound and left vulnerable in the Dark Forest, indicating a moment of helplessness or capture.
Finally shakes free of the vines and jumps up, sensing danger.
Looks up at the trees but only sees vague shadows.
Rooted to the spot for a moment, then loses her nerve and runs.
Fights to get away when grabbed, bites captor to defend herself.
Warns Eric about the Queen and her brother's attempts on her life sincerely.
Shows desperation and fear but remains truthful about her situation.
Warnings about Finn's betrayal despite risking further anger from Eric.
Expresses concern for both herself and Eric’s safety.
During intense conflict, runs away alone rather than staying to help or negotiate.
Panic and flee terrified into the forest when threatened.
On being suddenly grabbed, immediately punches Eric with all her strength.
Draws Eric's dagger to defend herself and assert control.
Draws a dagger to defend herself and tells Eric to get away.
Explains that the Queen wants them all dead, showing concern for others.
Appeals to Eric for help despite his hostility, promising reward and emphasizing mutual danger.
Offers a generous payment and gives her word to ensure safe delivery, demonstrating sincerity and trustworthiness.
Draws a dagger to defend herself, commands Eric to stay away.
Clearly explains the Queen's threat and her own value in a tense situation.
Takes a calculated risk by appealing to Eric's self-interest to secure safe passage.
Offers a high reward to secure Eric's help, showing negotiation skills and confidence.
Appeals emotionally but effectively to emphasize mutual risk ('You're dead if you return without me.')
Follows Eric after he walks away despite being rejected, showing persistence.
Offers her hand to shake and gives her word despite mistrust.
Confidently stands off against Eric, asserting her intentions strongly.
Insists on going to the Duke's castle on her terms, showing determination and independence.
Negotiates payment openly and straightforwardly with Eric for safe passage.
Insists on a sworn promise from Eric, showing cautious trust but no warmth yet.
Shows sensitivity and concern after seeing the deer rib cage and butterflies, asking about possible pursuit.
Proposes a clear reward to Eric and directly negotiates the price to secure his help.
Insists Eric swear to deliver her to safety, demonstrating assertiveness and awareness of trust importance.
Seems unsure about Eric's qualities and uncertain about what to make of him, showing some hesitation.
Notices the rib cage with butterflies and is visibly shocked, indicating sensitivity but possibly vulnerability.
Asks pragmatic questions about whether enemies will follow and about their progress through the forest, showing concern and awareness of their situation.
Accepts a flask of mead offered by Eric, though reluctantly and politely, then returns it.
Turns to face Eric after he warns her about drinking the stream water.
Does not show dismissiveness or rudeness to Eric's crude explanation of animal droppings.
Approaches a stream, splashes her face, drinks from the water despite warning from Eric, then quickly spits most of it out and returns the flask.
Shows curiosity and asks Eric about the animal dropping, indicating situational awareness.
Reacts physically to the unpleasant nature of the animal dropping but maintains composure.
Hits Eric behind the knees to snap him out of a dangerous illusion and drags him away from harm.
Watches Eric with compassion after he calms down and struggles.
Questions Eric about the mysterious apparition, showing concern and desire to understand.
Hits Eric behind the knees to stop him from walking toward danger, shows quick thinking and physical action to prevent harm.
Calms Eric down by asserting the illusion is not real and gets him to regain composure.
Watches Eric with compassion but does not intervene further when he walks away exhausted.
Follows Eric's instructions attentively despite the harshness of training; maintains focus and trust during close and intense interaction.
Catches a knife thrown to her unexpectedly.
Follows Eric's instructions about foot positioning and defense techniques despite initial confusion.
Raises her forearm to parry and block as taught, demonstrating quick learning.
Locks eyes with Eric and drives the knife through him as instructed, showing focus and courage.
Asks why she needs to learn how to kill, indicating some hesitation or moral questioning.
Shows concern by asking 'Where are you going?' indicating attentiveness to Eric.
Follows Eric through the Dark Forest and over the bridge, showing trust and cooperation.
Expresses relief when nearing safety from the Dark Forest, showing emotional openness and sincerity.
Focuses intently on Eric when he speaks, engaging seriously in the situation.
Asks relevant and situational questions (e.g., 'Where are you going?', 'Is this the end of the Dark Forest?'), showing awareness and involvement.
Appears relieved when following Eric out of the Dark Forest but relies heavily on Eric’s lead rather than taking independent action.
Runs back to rescue the wounded Eric despite her terror, screaming to distract the Troll.
Stares at the bridge and feels relieved upon seeing open fens beyond, indicating situational awareness and hope.
Hesitates when seeing Eric injured and in danger from the troll, initially terrified and unsure what to do.
Turns back despite fear and approaches the troll, screaming and pulling her knife to confront the threat and protect Eric.
Stands her ground against the towering troll and pulls her knife despite fear.
Stares into the troll's eyes, perceives gentle nature, and pacifies it without violence.
Refuses to run as instructed, asserting that running would have led to Eric's death and demands thanks.
Steps forward into the light and says 'We mean you no harm.'
Stops to acknowledge and accept the little girl offering her hand, despite visible discomfort at the scar.
Steps forward into the light, speaks calmly to show peaceful intent.
Notices the scar on another character's face but tries not to stare, showing social awareness.
Quietly asks why others are staring at her, indicating some uncertainty or lack of understanding of the social dynamic.
Plays gently with Lily making dolls and appreciates the doll despite its scar.
Shows sympathy and sadness about the peaceful place reminding her of loss.
Shares vulnerability about her past and admits difficulty in saying certain words.
Plays peacefully with Lily, makes dolls from straw, shows empathy and appreciation for beauty.
Admits she cannot bring herself to say important words about her identity and past trauma.
Expresses thoughtful reflection on her feelings and memories rather than reacting impulsively.
Gratefully accepts the protection charm from Eric and thanks him sincerely.
Observes and comments gently on the beauty of the children sleeping nearby, showing tenderness.
Shows surprise and openness to Anna's serious comment about sacrifice, indicating receptiveness and respect.
Engages with Eric thoughtfully, asks questions about the charm and its origin, accepts protection with gratitude.
Lies in bed contemplatively, shows surprise at Anna's words but no evident action or planning.
Awakens, notices Eric is gone, keeps a memento (puts something in her pocket), smells smoke, looks outside and perceives the danger of burning arrows raining down on the village.
Pushes Lily away from the flaming arrow to protect her and stabs a mercenary in the leg impulsively to prevent harm.
Stares at the injured mercenary's face and pain for a moment, showing a humanizing hesitation.
Immediately commands Anna to run and then faces the mercenary to defend herself and others.
Moments of recognition and uncertainty when seeing William, standing still and silent, reflecting a complex internal state rather than coldness or hostility.
Pushes Lily away from the fire and grabs the flaming arrow to use as a weapon.
Backhand stabs a mercenary in the leg with the flaming arrow, causing him to tumble and catch fire.
Momentarily hesitates after incapacitating the mercenary, staring at him instead of quickly moving on.
Races out of the hut with Anna and Lily after the attack, responding appropriately to danger.
Faces off against a fearsome mercenary, commands Anna to run, then attempts to defend herself by slashing him with a knife when he approaches.
Is knocked to the ground and apparently passive when the mercenary advances, waiting silently for rescue.
Stares at William, a warrior from her past, instead of immediately reacting or escaping when he appears.
Struggles violently against Eric when grabbed, attempts to defend herself with a knife.
Insists on helping others despite being physically restrained and urged to escape.
Becomes physically overpowered and is dragged away despite resisting, showing limited success in immediate self-defense.
Looks at Eric with empathy when he blames himself.
Bites one of her captors while being pinned down.
Allows herself to be captured and tied up without apparent attempt to escape or resist effectively beyond biting.
Shows empathy toward Eric despite difficult circumstances.
Questions Eric about what he did to the dwarves, showing concern for their wellbeing.
Encourages Eric to tell the dwarves the truth, promoting honesty.
Responds fiercely to Gus's stare, indicating a defensive or less tolerant reaction.
Whispers to Eric to reveal the truth about the hidden bounty.
Responds fiercely to Gus's ogling, asserting herself confidently.
Does not take overt control of the conflict or the situation with the dwarves and Eric, allowing tension to persist.
Allows Muir to touch her face, softening his demeanor and eliciting a smile.
Asks Beith if he hates the Queen, initiating a moment of shared understanding.
Maintains calm and composed interactions despite hostile surroundings and captors.
Observes her captors carefully and notices details such as the blind dwarf and his son.
Asks Beith a pointed question: 'Do you hate the Queen?'
Remains calm and composed when Eric, the huntsman, tries to calm her with a look.
Does not react rashly or emotionally despite being a captive and in a tense situation.
Offers to pay the dwarves handsomely for their help, showing generosity and respect for their contribution.
Insists that both she and the Huntsman will go together, displaying loyalty and willingness to share danger.
Successfully negotiates payment with the dwarves, offering a persuasive and generous reward.
Insists on loyalty by stating 'Both of us' will hang if things go wrong, demonstrating leadership and commitment.
Mesmerized by the beauty and music of Sanctuary, shows appreciation for nature.
Allowed herself to be cut loose by Gus without protest, demonstrating trust and cooperation.
Observes and follows the dwarves and the huntsman safely through a complex cave system despite physical difficulty.
Mesmerized by the environment, asks questions to understand her surroundings.
Relies on others (Gus) to be freed and escorted to safety rather than taking independent action.
Smiles warmly while observing the dwarves singing, sharing a moment of joy with the huntsman.
Walks over and sits beside Muir, thanks him sincerely for defending her.
Responds politely and shows gratitude to Muir for defending her.
Walks over to Muir and sits beside him without hesitation, engaging calmly with others.
Expresses sympathy to Muir over his loss.
Accepts Gus's invitation to dance graciously.
Responds graciously to Gus's invitation to dance, engaging socially despite difficult circumstances.
Expresses sympathy appropriately upon hearing about her father's death.
Smiles kindly at Gus despite being stepped on, showing patience and friendliness.
Invites the Huntsman to dance and offers to teach him, demonstrating openness and good-naturedness.
Maintains sincerity and eye contact while teaching the Huntsman to dance, fostering trust and warmth.
Initiates dancing with the huntsman shortly after making light of her poor dancing skills, showing confidence and willingness to teach despite her own admission.
Responds graciously to Gus' teasing about her dancing, indicating emotional intelligence and composure.
Engages the huntsman in teaching him to dance, displaying confidence in her abilities and leadership in the situation.
Breaks away from Gus to approach the huntsman after noticing his gaze, showing social awareness and decisiveness.
Sits amazed, drinking in the sights and sounds of nature; animals gather around her peacefully.
Is approached and blessed by a majestic white hart, animals show trust and reverence towards her.
Sits amazed, calmly observes and appreciates the magical surroundings and creatures around her.
Follows the direction of the magical fairies confidently, walking towards the dazzling light with animals falling in alongside her.
Does not display confusion or hesitation despite the mystical and unfamiliar environment.
Strokes the hart’s neck, bringing golden light and healing effect.
Shows calm and connection to nature and animals, indicating sincerity and care.
Strokes the hart's neck, causing golden light to brighten and engulf her, indicating a healing or empowering presence.
Does not physically defend herself when attacked; relies on others (Gus) to rescue her from danger.
Maintains a calm, healing presence amid an attack, not panicking despite sudden violence and threat.
Stops Gus from attacking William, showing restraint and concern for others' safety.
Recognizes William and shows surprise, indicating awareness and engagement with others.
Pulls William off his horse just before Gus attacks, preventing unnecessary violence.
Does not appear to effectively anticipate or avoid the pursuit and threat around her, allowing herself to be chased and nearly attacked.
Stares in disbelief with tears of surprise when recognizing William, indicating emotional openness and sincerity.
Falls to her knees in anguish, cradling the dying Gus, showing compassion, care, and emotional connection.
Recognizes William and shows emotional intelligence by responding with surprise and tears, indicating awareness and connection in a tense moment.
Falls to her knees in anguish, cradling the dying Gus, showing emotional vulnerability but no immediate strategic reaction to danger.
Leads the seven dwarves in chanting a low prayer around Gus's body.
Allows tension to rise between Eric and William without intervening immediately.
Leads a vigil around Gus's body, surrounded by the dwarves, showing her role as a respected leader and organizer in a difficult moment.
Does not intervene in the escalating tension between Eric and William, which could indicate a lack of control or confidence in managing conflict.
Tells the huntsman to leave because he is their friend, showing care even amidst conflict.
Bows over Gus's body, sobbing and mourning deeply for their loss.
Intervenes to protect the huntsman by telling others to leave him alone, showing leadership and confidence.
Is bowed over Gus's body, sobbing and mourning, displaying vulnerability but also emotional depth and loyalty.
Looks heartbroken as the dwarves shed tears and a funeral pyre is lit, sharing in the group sorrow.
Responds to William's apology with forgiveness and reassurance: 'You didn't.' and 'We were children, William. You're here now.'
Accepts Eric's help climbing the slope without hesitation, showing trust and cooperation.
Warms herself by the fire while others are interacting and preparing for journey.
Warms herself by the fire while others discuss plans and skills.
Feels only sorrow for Ravenna despite people's hatred towards her.
Stares back at William uncertainly when he says people will rise up in her name.
Reflects quietly and observes the surroundings calmly, showing composure and thoughtfulness.
Expresses sorrow for Ravenna instead of hatred despite being encouraged to expect popular support as the rightful heir, indicating emotional depth but uncertainty about a leadership role.
Acknowledges she is not her father and doubts that her name alone will inspire uprising, showing a realistic and grounded perspective about her capacity and influence.
Appears uncertain and ridden with doubt when confronted about her duty and potential as queen, reflecting a lack of full confidence and decisiveness in her role.

Responds to William's affectionate words with a soft smile, tries to make light of the sentiment, engages in gentle playful interaction with him by snatching the apple and sharing a moment of nostalgia.
Reflects thoughtfully on how to inspire and lead others, showing self-awareness and inquiry into her own leadership abilities.
Remembers and playfully responds to William's nostalgic trick by snatching the apple from him before he can take a bite, demonstrating quick reflexes and situational awareness.
Appears momentarily lost in William's gaze during a serious conversation, trailing off without completing her thought, indicating a lapse in focus and control.
Suffers poison and physical petrification but remains alert and open-eyed, silently enduring suffering without complaint or malice.
Despite being poisoned and petrified, keeps her eyes open taking in everything and remains aware of her surroundings.
Collapses and chokes from poison, becoming incapacitated and vulnerable.
Lies poisoned and unresponsive, unable to take action or signal for help, despite being conscious briefly.
Addresses the gathered people standing in her white funeral robes, showing courage and readiness to support her people in battle alongside Duke Hammond.
Speaks with gentle but quiet conviction, showing sincere dedication to her people's welfare.
Appears before the council and people despite her heart pounding, showing courage and resolve.
Speaks with quiet conviction that she has rested enough and is ready to fight alongside the Duke.
Insists on riding into battle despite the Duke’s advice to stay safe behind walls.
Encourages her people to not give up and expresses willingness to fight for them despite personal risk.
Acknowledges that she is inspired by her people's hopes and courage, showing mutual respect and sincerity.
Rejects the idea of staying safely behind walls, choosing to share danger with her people.
Declares she can defeat the Queen despite doubts from others, demonstrating confidence and determination.
Leads her people by descending to their level and delivering an inspiring speech that shifts their perspective.
Admits she is not a traditional leader, queen, or warrior which shows self-awareness rather than false bravado.
Rejects staying safe behind walls and chooses to actively face danger, showing decisiveness and bravery.
Offers to ride alone to meet the enemy if necessary, highlighting courage but also a potential risk of overconfidence or isolation.
Offers to give her life for her people and country, inviting others to join her.
Feels overwhelmed by the faith and trust shown by her followers, showing sincerity and humility.
Shares a warm moment of happiness upon seeing Eric, displaying friendly and trusting behavior.
Leads an army composed not only of soldiers but also rebels, peasants, and women all willing to follow her.
Offers a hope-filled plan involving timing the portcullis opening with sunrise despite the dire situation.
Proposes a tactical timing strategy to be at the portcullis when the sun clears the horizon, indicating knowledge of castle defenses and timing.
Suggests immediate action to ride now before the portcullis is closed, showing awareness of timing and urgency.
Takes her father's banner and holds it aloft, rallying the men and riding on despite danger.
Sees men falling around her and has tears welling up but never falters.
Takes her father's banner and holds it aloft, rallying the men and riding on despite fire raining down and danger all around.
Seems emotionally affected with tears welling in her eyes but does not falter or hesitate in continuing her charge.
Holds up shield to protect herself from arrows while refusing to retreat.
Tells William she gave her word to stand with the trapped soldiers.
Holds up her shield to protect herself from a sea of arrows, showing resilience and courage under fire.
Refuses to retreat despite the danger, demonstrating commitment and bravery.
Smiles in relief and gallops through the open gates once the portcullis lifts, confidently seizing the opportunity to advance.
Leads the charge into the castle despite danger, fights alongside her army.
Focuses on battle strategy and leadership under pressure.
Goes through fire to the side door, rushing into the castle despite impending trap, continuing the offense aggressively.
Leads her army in a tough fight forming a defensive wedge and pushing through enemy soldiers, showing tactical capability.
Fails to notice or avoid the trap set by Ravenna as she rushes into the castle, triggering a roadblock.
Storms into the throne room determined to confront Ravenna, saying 'It ends today... I have come for YOU!'
Witnesses her allies being attacked and protected by razor-sharp shards but shows concern for them
Unable to help Eric and William trapped by hostile forces
Storms into the throne room determined to confront Ravenna.
Faces Ravenna directly despite fear, declares 'It ends today... I have come for YOU!'
Unable to assist Eric and William when the shards attack and trap them.
Looks at Eric and William but is unable to help them being attacked by Dark Faeries.
Walks up the stairs torn and powerless, looks at Eric one last time.
Braces herself and follows Ravenna into the mirror room, facing her directly.
Lunges toward Ravenna and tries to strike her with her sword in combat.
Walks up the stairs torn and powerless while others fight, unable to help.
Braces herself and follows Ravenna into the mirror room, showing readiness to confront her.
Lunges and strikes at Ravenna with her sword, acting on heart rather than strategy.
Gets easily thrown across the room by Ravenna with little effort.
Frees herself from Ravenna's grasp and fights back fiercely despite being breathless.
Frees herself from Ravenna's grasp despite being dazed.
Swings her sword at Ravenna, parrying attacks with bare hands and continuing to fight while breathless.
Is overpowered when Ravenna blocks her final strike and does not let go.
Despite severe pain, injury, and overwhelming power against her, she refuses to back down and stands up to continue fighting.
Parries every attack with her bare hands despite being breathless.
Struggles to break free from Ravenna's hold but ultimately is overpowered and injured.
Holds onto her sword tightly even when her wrist is twisted and bones crack.
Drops her sword after being incapacitated by Ravenna's attack.
Stands up despite exhaustion, injury, and feeling powerless, showing determination.
Feels powerless, lost, and exhausted in the face of overwhelming enemy power.
Tries to reach her sword despite being choked and pinned down by Ravenna, attempts to drag herself closer despite disadvantageous position.
Unable to get the sword in time to defend herself against Ravenna's attack.
Blocks Ravenna's strike and uses her dagger to undo Ravenna's spell, showing courage and determination to protect and save others.
Blocks Ravenna's strike, reaches for her dagger and plunges it into Ravenna's chest, applying training taught by the huntsman.
Speaks the counter incantation 'By fairest blood... it is undone!' effectively reversing Ravenna's spell.
Kneels beside Ravenna, showing compassion and places her hand on Ravenna's chest despite her being the enemy.
Calms Ravenna with a whisper, showing tenderness and reassurance amid tension.
Shows understanding instead of anger or hate toward Ravenna in her final moments.
Approaches Ravenna with compassion and shows calmness in a tense moment, offering comfort and speaking reassuringly.
Kneels beside a dying enemy and interacts with her in a motherly, composed manner, indicating emotional intelligence and confidence.
Does not display hesitation or confusion in a critical, emotionally charged scene involving the antagonist's death.
Smiles and warmly acknowledges her subjects and friends, meeting their eyes with affection.
Shares a meaningful, sincere look with Eric, displaying a personal connection amidst the crowd.
Smiles confidently, acknowledges and connects with her subjects and friends during the coronation.
Maintains calm and dignified presence despite being surrounded by many important figures.
Passively looks around the crowd and meets eyes with Eric but takes no further visible action.
